clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the treatment of atrial fibrillation and flutter and heart failure

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Ouabain a cardiac glycoside similar to digitoxin is used to treat congestive heart failure and supraventricular arrhythmias due to reentry mechanisms and to control ventricular rate in the treatment of chronic atrial fibrillation

incompatibilities.description: The serum concentration of Ouabain can be increased when it is combined with Amiodarone
The risk or severity of adverse effects can be increased when Amphotericin B is combined with Ouabain

Edrophonium may increase the atrioventricular blocking AV block and arrhythmogenic activities of Ouabain
